page.title: 08LIFE STYLE
page.content: Many of the people interviewed in Teversham chose to live there because of their love for the countryside and the quietness of village life, and they were also near to the city. We found that the older residents who were well established used the village shop more than the relative newcomers, who tended to shop in the Cambridge supermarkets and also found liesure facilities to their taste in Cambridge. Teversham village has a strong branch of the Royal British Legion for ex-servicemen, and it also boasts a "Conservative Club", as well as the usual village organisations. Many of the residents found pleasure in tending their gardens and looking after their houses and cars.
